58.heading: American Expatriates.
58.title: Cairo : a Graphic Novel
58.author: written by G
58.appears_in: Willow Wilson ; art by M.K. Perker ; lettered by Travis Lanham.
notes: Summary: In bustling modern-day Cairo, the lives of a drug runner, a down-on-his-luck journalist, an American expatriate, a young activist, an Israeli soldier, and a genie are interwoven as they navigate the city's streets and spiritual underworld to find a stolen hooka sought by a wrathful gangster-magician.

81.heading: American Flagg--Articles About.
81.title: Give Our Regards to the Atomsmashers! : Writers on Comics
81.author: edited and with an introduction by Sean Howe.
notes: CONTENTS (from dust jacket): Jonathan Lethem on childhood friendships and the return of Jack Kirby ; Luc Sante on the clear lines and ageless world of Tintin ; Geoff Dyer on Spider-Man and how comic book art colored the author's world ; Aimee Bender on Yummy Fur and storytelling ; Christopher Sorrentino on the DC/Marvel rivalry and a child's need to be accepted ; Steve Erickson on the wildly subversive American Flagg ; Gary Giddins on learning the Classics through Classics Illustrated ; Brad Meltzer on young love and the New Teen Titans ; John Wray on horror, guilt, and the humor of Jim Woodring ; Geoffrey O'Brien on Nick Fury and the end of the comic book world ; Glen David Gold on Adam Warlock and the nature of collecting ; Lydia Millet on the dreamscapes of Little Nemo in Slumberland ; Tom Piazza on the ingenuousness and perversity of Bizarro and Mxyzptlk ; Chris Offutt on NoMan and life as an outsider ; Greil Marcus on Uncle Sam and the unfulfilled promise of America ; Myla Goldberg on the complex narratives and tantalizing visuals of Renée French and Chris Ware ; Andrew Hultkrans on being a disciple of Steve Ditko.

118.library has: no 1. 1. Science fiction comic books, strips, etc. I. First Comics. Call no.

119.heading: American Flags.
119.title: "America's Flags : The Story of Old Glory" 8 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 4
119.author: [No author]
notes: "A thousand years has seen many banners over the American continent, giving the star-spangled banner a noble and dramatic lineage."

120.heading: American Flags.
120.title: "The Battle of the Cannon Ball!"
120.author: [No author]
120.series: Fantastic Facts) 1 p. in Star Spangled Comics, no. 114
notes: Illustrated facts about the War of 1812 on Lake Ontario, wooden shoes, the American Flag, a dwarf spy, and a medical book from 400 B.C.

121.heading: American Flags.
121.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55 "American flag"
121.author: [No author]

123.heading: American Flags.
123.title: "Famous Flags in American History"
123.author: B
123.appears_in: Geller. p. 8 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 11, no. 1 (Sept. 8, 1955).

124.heading: American Flags.
124.title: "Fantastic Facts"
124.author: by Geo
124.appears_in: Papp. 1 p. in Real Fact Comics, no. 4 (Sept./Oct. 1946).
notes: Illustrated items about the War of 1812, wooden shoes, a dwarf in the French Revolution, toothbrushing, and the American flag.

125.heading: American Flags.
125.title: "Historical Game Page" p. 34 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 8, no. 19
125.author: [No author]
notes: Quiz about historical dates and historical American flags.

126.heading: American Flags.
126.title: "La Jirafa y el Águila Celebran las Fiestas Nacionales"
126.author: [No author]
126.series: Zany Jirafa) 3 p. in Super Gato, no. 10
notes: The flag on the giraffe's neck is the 48-star U.S. flag.

127.heading: American Flags.
127.title: "Our Flag Was Still There!" 4 p. in True Comics, no. 32
127.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: The story of Mary Pickersgill, who made the flag that inspired the U.S. national anthem. 1. Pickersgill, Mary
Comic books, strips, etc. 2. Star Spangled Banner. k. Flags. k. National anthem. Call no.: PN6728.1.P3T7no.32

128.heading: American Flags.
128.title: "Real World"
128.author: by Alison Bechdel.
128.series: Dykes to Watch Out For, no. 374, Oct. 3, 2001
notes: Summary: Silent strip, showing the World Trade Center attack on a television set, and reactions to it, including hugging, anger, violence toward Arab Americans, American flags, the peace symbol, meditation and demonstration, unplugging the television coverage, and contemplating George W. Bush.

129.heading: American Flags.
129.title: "The 3 E's"
129.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: Education is symbolized by the letter E: Evolution, Ebonics and Ethnocentrism.

130.heading: American Flags.
130.title: "The True Story of Our Flag" 2 p. text in Star Spangled Comics, no. 2
130.author: [No author]
notes: "The dramatic account of the Stars and Stripes' first appearance on the battle field."

131.title: American Flags in the Comics : file of clippings and examples.
131.author: [No author]
notes: Collected at Michigan State University in the Russel B. Nye Popular Culture Collection's Popular Culture Vertical File (PCVF). 1. Flags

132.title: American Flyer Funnies.
132.author: [No author]
132.library has: no. 1-2. 1. Underground comic books, strips, etc. Call no.

136.heading: American Foreign Policy.
136.title: "The Freedom Cop : Andrew Dagilis discusses Brought to Light, American foreign policy, and Central America." p. 55-60 in The Comics Journal, no. 129
136.author: [No author]
notes: Review of Brought to Light; about the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency.

137.heading: American Foundation for AIDS Research.
137.title: AIDS : acquired immune deficiency syndrome
137.author: script by Malcolm Ater ; with invaluable editorial assistance from the U
137.appears_in: S. Center for Disease Control and American Foundation for AIDS Research.
notes: Comic books, strips, etc. I. Ater, Malcolm. II. Center for Disease Control. III. American Foundation for AIDS Research. Call no.: RA644.A25A8 1987

138.heading: American Foundation for AIDS Research.
138.title: "AMFAR Information" 1 p. in Within Our Reach
138.author: [No author]
notes: Information on the American Foundation for AIDS Research.

139.heading: American Founding Father.
139.title: Serra : American Founding Father
139.author: illustrated and coloring by John Tartaglione ; inking, Michael Esposito ; text, Roy Gasnick, ; lettering Bill Spicer.
notes: Biographical genre ; about 18th century Franciscan missions in California.

140.heading: The American Foundress of the School Sisters of Notre Dame.
140.title: "The Mother of Notre Dame : Mother Caroline, the American Foundress of the School Sisters of Notre Dame" p. 31-36 in Topix, v. 6, no. 8
140.author: [No author]
notes: "From the book Running Waters, by Covelle Newcomb."

141.heading: American Foxhounds.
141.title: "Hounds" text p. 49-54 in A Treasury of Dogs
141.author: [No author]
notes: Pictures and descriptions of the Irish Wolfhound, Saluki, Afghan Hound, Basenji, Basset Hound, Beagle, Bloodhound, Dachshund, American Foxhound, and Greyhound.

142.title: American Freak : a Tale of the Un-men
142.author: Dave Louapre, writer ; Vince Locke, artist.

144.heading: American Freakshow.

144.author: story by Steve Niles ; art by Chee ; colors by Chong Chung.
